intro: Cybianthus cogolloi, commonly known as the Cogollo's cybianthus, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its limited habitat and threats from habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species.
